thread.title: Android O released to developers! Here’s everything that’s new
thread.title_full: Android O released to developers! Here’s everything that’s new

author: Brandon Russell
title: Android O released to developers! Here’s everything that’s new
text:
Google on Tuesday rolled out the first Developer Preview of Android O, promising the software will address a number of issues, from improving battery life to providing users with better notifications. The final name of the software hasn’t yet been unveiled.
This is the second year in a row Google has quietly rolled out a big new Android update, doing the same thing last March with Android N.
According to a report from The Verge, Google is focusing a lot of attention of improving battery life, particularly focusing on limiting what apps can do in the background. Apple’s iOS currently manages what apps can do in the background, and it appears Google is taking a similar approach.
Google is also making a point to improve Android notifications—something Google has been trying to perfect over the past few years. The report says Android O is able to group notifications into channels. Google apparently didn’t expand much on how this might improve a user’s day-to-day experience.
In addition, there are some smaller additions coming, including a picture-in-picture mode for videos, multi-display support for launching an activity on a remote display, improved keyboard navigation, and greater support for headphones with “high-quality Bluetooth audio codecs.”
